text: RT @belensisaw On this 7th anniversary of #DACA, I’m reflecting on how the bravery of those undocumented youth that made it happen is what empowered me to be who I am today.

Welcomed news for baby Londyn & the research team at @UFHealthNews. Londyn is the first baby in the US to be treated w/newly approved gene therapy to treat SMA, a leading genetic cause of infant death. My prayers are w/ her & her family as medical professionals treat the disease. https://twitter.com/UFHealthNews/status/1139179330137804800 QT @UFHealthNews .@UFHealth patient first to receive new gene therapy for neuromuscular disease since federal regulators’ approval https://ufhealth.org/news/2019/uf-health-patient-first-receive-new-gene-therapy-neuromuscular-disease-fda-approval http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D88tjG1UIAEjv0W.jpg

The murder of Black trans women is a crisis. We’ll fight this, and we will continue to say their names. https://twitter.com/AshleeMPreston/status/1140019743853645824 QT @AshleeMPreston I’m just at this place in my life where; if you don’t have time to discuss the genocide of black trans women or systemic anti-blackness in America—we have no business to discuss with one another. If you’re tired of hearing about it; imagine how we feel living every moment of it.

Too many Americans have to work two or three jobs to cover their student loans, pay their rent, and keep food on the table. My LIFT Act would raise incomes for working and middle-class families by up to $500/mo.

Today seven years ago, President @BarackObama implemented #DACA to give a generation of immigrants a chance to build a future in the country they call home. I will #DefendDACA and keep standing up to Donald Trump’s cruel attacks on immigrant communities.

RT @TheRaDR Ok, Internet. Time to learn the difference between concentration camps and death (“extermination”) camps.

Germany started with concentration camps in 1933. 

Death camps started in 1941. 

Never again is now. https://twitter.com/marloncmanning/status/1139623221131730944 QT @marloncmanning @TheRaDR Peace Be Unto U Rabbi. While I believe in a immigration referendum, and that camp conditions for migrant are not good. I wouldn't associate U.S. camps to Nazi camps. No mass killing going on, starvation etc...

Republicans want to suppress votes and gerrymander districts because they can't win on their ideas. That is cowardice.

We have a better idea: make it easier for all people to vote, run for office and get involved in politics. That is democracy.

DACA was announced to the world 7 years ago today, paving the way for hundreds of thousands of DREAMers to come out of the shadows in the only country they know as home. We have to keep fighting for a pathway to citizenship for these young people—America is their home.
